Procrastination and Motivation

A note to self

Motivation is overrated.

Something that I need to remember is that reflection has it‚Äôs limitations. It‚Äôs limitations being that after the 30 second mark, you‚Äôre probably just procrastinating.

Speaking of procrastination, this blog post is a way for me to take my mind off of the stuff I have to do in the next two days. I‚Äôve got a lot. I tend to have problems with tasks when I don‚Äôt like doing it to the extent where I avoid thinking about it. The only way I‚Äôve found a way to do these kinds of things is to try to make it something I automatically do without thinking. Usually by tacking it on the end of something I already do every day.

The two issues with this. If I don‚Äôt do that thing that triggers the automatic action, the task won‚Äôt get done. The second issue is that I don‚Äôt know that I didn‚Äôt do it. My goal here is to think by writing and get to a solution that works. A secondary goal is to get better at writing, so I eventually don‚Äôt hesitate to make a post.

To mitigate the issue of not wanting to think about hard tasks I could try to streamline my calendar/task system, but I‚Äôm notorious for using that as a way to procrastinate. Maybe it‚Äôs a motivational issue?

Maybe‚Ä¶ Or, I could try to solve the lack of motivation with some kind of reward? No‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt think of anything that would work as a reward. In order for there to be a reward, rules must be put in place.

Maybe adding some rules to my life would make it more structured and meaningful. It‚Äôs worth a shot. Time to think of some examples, I guess.

Layout: Problem: Solution by adhering a rule.

  1. Distraction: Reduce distracting entertainment by removing things that make me start watching
  2. Distraction/Procrastination:
    1. Make a template for an average day
    2. Plan out specific things I‚Äôll work on with estimated duration.
    3. ???
    4. Profit/Actually get things done

Maybe I can avoid procrastination by forcing a habit of doing everything as early as I can, while changing my environment to help reduce distractions.

To ensure I don‚Äôt go completely insane, I think I‚Äôll throw on music while I work to help my morale last long enough to get everything done.

Alrighty, I guess it‚Äôs time for me to go do the things I don‚Äôt want to do. Cya, have a great day!
